name: Red Arrow Inn & Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not let the outside fool you! Our room was amazing! It was huge with a bathroom the size of my first apartment! We had a king room with a whirlpool tub and seperate shower. Nice staff. They gave us a 2 queen at first, when we had confirmed a king bed. The staff took care of the problem right away. Full hot breakfast was great....
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here during a business trip. First, the value was great. The room was huge and clean. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and sincerely interested in providing you with a pleasant stay. I stayed here because TripAdvisor had it rated as #1 and the price was where I wanted it to be. I was not disappointed at all. The mattress was great, too. I slept like a baby. The breakfast was among the better of the "serve yourself" kind of breakfasts. Among the in-room amenities was a microwave, wi-fi, fridge, alarm clock, iron & ironing board and a large whirlpool tub. I am tall so I particularly appreciated the adjustable shower head in the over-sized shower.
reviews.title: Quite a nice find, you should stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: However, had I been in a different room, things might've gone just fine. But I got the last room so there was no switching.
reviews.title: Worst experience I've ever had at a hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was infested with large moths (something I didn't fully realize until I began killing them and they kept appearing) with no logical reason for them to be there. The girl at the front desk gave me some bug spray and a fly swatter but there were still more than I thought and the bug spray smelled horrible. I killed 40 of them and there were at least 20 more still alive (that I could see) so the girl called a place that had rooms available and gave me a hand-written discount to give them (presumably on top of my AAA discount). The next hotel was perplexed by the card and, basically, I found out it was worthless.
reviews.title: Unexpected GREAT value for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most other reviews here seem recount very different, pleasurable (at least not horror-movie-like) experiences so I can only assume my experience was a fluke. ?
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here after spending a day at Black Canyon of the Gunnison NP. Our two queen bed room on the first floor was nice and very spacious with a large full-length window view of a lush green lawn. Since we had 4 adults in the same room, the separate vanity/dressing area and the bathroom provided plenty of privacy. There was an outdoor pool, indoor hot tub and fitness room. But for us the best part was the breakfast. The breakfast room was spacious with several tables for many guests. There were hot items (egg and cheese omelet, sausage, biscuit and gravy, waffles) and heated turnover pastry as well as breads, bagel, muffins and cereal. There was also fresh fruit and canned fruit, good coffee and creamer. We had a nice stay here.
reviews.title: Nice room, great breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff, clean spacious room, comfortable beds, continental breakfast, fridge, coffee maker, microwave, private patio, located near Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park, excellent Italian food at Garlic Mike's Restaurant within walking distance of the hotel.
reviews.title: Good value for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great place to stay! Rooms are huge & very clean, vanity area has exceptional lighting & a make-up mirror. Breakfast area was bright & cheerful and while food was standard continental breakfast fare, it was presented well and actual mugs for coffee. Fresh, cut fruit and small turn-overs were an added treat. We stayed here two nights and couldn't have been more pleased. High speed internet service was excellent, also.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here one night en route to Mesa Verde--no reservations, just showed up. Desk staff was very helpful, value was excellent, it had a HOT breakfast included in the room rate, and even a computer in the lobby available for guest use. Our room had two queen beds and a nice bathroom. It was a pleasant and welcome surprise.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Almost last room of the day..huge room, very clean, friendly service. Definately recommend.
reviews.title: Great Value & Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice place to stay with all the right amenities. VERY spacious rooms and a great free breakfast. Location was far from anything (restaurants or stores), but one of the closest motels to the Black Canyon of the Gunnison, if that is where you are going (it's worth it!). Only one negitive expereince to report, though. At check out, the desk clerk never even looked up from the computer and never said a word. "Thanks and have nice day" would have been nice. Oh well...
reviews.title: Have to agree with everyone - a great motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived late in the evening and it was pouring rain - went inside and the front desk lady was super friendly and got us in our room in no time. The room was large and the bath was exceptional. Large Jacuzzi tub, separate shower, nice vanity area and the bed was super comfy! All the things that make a motel/hotel great! We'd stay there again in a heartbeat and would recommend this location to friends and family. Very, very pleasant experience!
reviews.title: Great, clean, modernized motel - wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on the unsolicited advice of a TripAdvisee after having a not-so-great (and expensive) experience at the Holiday Inn Express last year. Service was great; we called ahead to get a quiet ground floor room we could park our bike in front of & they provided just that. The rooms are gigantic w/ some hilarious quirky details like the corded wall extension phone in the bathroom(!) and the inset bookshelf filled w/ Readers Digest condensed book (partly obscured by the synthetic plant.) The room hasn't been updated in quite awhile -- our sofa was a bit threadbare and the carpets had stains. But the essentials were all covered: Good wi-fi, decent shower, comfortable bed, fridge. One pet peeve is the overstuffed pillows. I had to sleep on a rolled up towel because the pillow hurt my neck. Also, the motel is on the more downtrodden side of town. Nothing wrong with that, just less picturesque if you like to take an evening walk. Depending on what you're looking for this BW could be awesome (the many 5 star reviews) or pretty average (my experience.)
reviews.title: Good value w/ a little wear & tear

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: This motel far exceeded our expectations. It is on the older side of Montrose that is nearer to the Black Canyon of the Gunnison. Our room was huge and spotlessly clean. Nice pillows and bedding; refrigerator, wi-fi, outdoor balcony overlooking lush, green yard. There was a beautifully maintained large outdoor pool and indoor hot tub. Laundry facilities were on the premises and breakfast was included. Staff was friendly and helpful. We thought this was an extraordinary value at $80 plus tax per night. Request a 2nd floor room on the back side to enjoy the peacefulness of the yard. It's worth doing the stairs (no elevator) if you are able.
reviews.title: Wonderful older motel with newer amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved this place, especially the kids. A long list of features: pool, hot tub, (basic) exercise room, laundry facilities, very large grassy play area with a swing set and a huge willow tree (gorgeous), barbecue grill, whirlpool tub in room, wireless internet. Very comfortable. Montrose is a wonderful little town. The hotel could use a good scrubbing, but nothing major.
reviews.title: Lots to love

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Well, I may be biased since they gave me a free "upgrade" and unlike the "upgrade" they gave me in Best Western in Flagstaff, this was a real thing. I got a second floor room with a wonderful spa bath tub which I used with great joy.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay, best BW I stayed in during this vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the room was clean, very roomy and very comfortable. The bed was comfortable, it was quiet and it definitely met all my needs. The staff folks were friendly and helpful, especially with directions since I was a stranger in a strange land. Needless to say, of all the Best Westerns I stayed in during this vacation, this one definitely take the cake as the best.
reviews.title: Time to spend some money renovating a one time great hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not the best or worst hotel we stayed on our vacation. Just average. The unit we stayed in appeared to be the original building when the hotel opened. Large rooms with very large bathrooms, but needs to be renovated. The staff at the front desk was very helpful with a great resturant in walking distance. Garlic Mike's. Don't eat anyplace else. Fantastic! Breakfast was very good in the morning. Best part of the stay.
reviews.title: Are There TWO Best Western Red Arrow Hotels?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I must have stayed in a different hotel than a lot of the reviewers have stayed at - our experience was not so good at the Red Arrow.
reviews.title: Not anything resembling the reviews!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is newly remodeled, it's clean and nice inside (not much to look at from the street, though).
reviews.title: Quiet, Relaxing, Great Location!

description: We offer much more than the basics - those little extras that make your stay even more comfortable. Amenities include: Free Hot Breakfast Microwave & fridge in all rooms, Playground, Exercise facility, Outdoor pool, heated, High-speed Internet access Guest laundry, Airport shuttle available, Fax services at Front Desk, Free parking, Outdoor parking, Truck/RV parking, Interior/Exterior corridor, Guest computer & Printer available, Ice/vending machines. We look forward to seeing you and becoming your home away from home!
